storyTitle: As Approver, I want to review schedule change requests to achieve timely and accurate approval decisions

testCases.title: Validate viewing and decision making on pending approvals
preconditions: Approver user account exists with valid credentials
Approver has been assigned appropriate role and permissions
At least one pending schedule change request is assigned to the approver
System is accessible and all services are running
Database contains valid test data in ScheduleChangeRequests table

steps.action: Navigate to the system login page and enter valid approver credentials (username and password)
steps.expectedResult: Approver is successfully authenticated and redirected to the dashboard/home page

steps.action: Click on 'Pending Approvals' menu item or navigate to the pending approvals dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Pending approvals page loads successfully displaying a list of all schedule change requests assigned to the logged-in approver with columns showing request ID, requester name, date submitted, and current status

steps.action: Select a specific schedule change request from the list by clicking on it
steps.expectedResult: Request details page opens showing comprehensive information including requester details, original schedule, proposed schedule, reason for change, supporting documentation, and submission timestamp

steps.action: Review all displayed information and click on 'Approve' button
steps.expectedResult: Approval dialog box appears with a text field for optional comments

steps.action: Enter approval comments in the comments field (e.g., 'Approved as requested - no conflicts identified')
steps.expectedResult: Comments are entered successfully in the text field

steps.action: Click 'Submit' button to confirm the approval decision
steps.expectedResult: System processes the approval, request status updates to 'Approved', timestamp is recorded, and a confirmation message is displayed stating 'Request has been successfully approved'

steps.action: Verify the request no longer appears in the pending approvals list
steps.expectedResult: The approved request is removed from the pending list and the list refreshes to show only remaining pending requests

postconditions: Request status is updated to 'Approved' in ScheduleChangeRequests table
Approval decision is recorded in ApprovalActions table with timestamp and approver ID
Approved request is removed from approver's pending queue
Requester can view the approved status of their request

testCases.title: Validate rejection of schedule change requests
preconditions: Approver is logged into the system with valid credentials
Approver has appropriate permissions to reject requests
At least one pending schedule change request exists in the system
Approver is on the pending approvals dashboard
Database is accessible and operational

steps.action: From the pending approvals list, click on a schedule change request to view its details
steps.expectedResult: Request details page opens displaying all relevant information including requester name, original schedule, proposed changes, reason for change, and submission date

steps.action: Review the request details and click on the 'Reject' button
steps.expectedResult: Rejection dialog box appears with a text field for mandatory or optional comments explaining the rejection reason

steps.action: Enter rejection comments in the comments field (e.g., 'Rejected due to insufficient staffing coverage during proposed time')
steps.expectedResult: Comments are successfully entered and visible in the text field

steps.action: Click 'Submit' button to confirm the rejection decision
steps.expectedResult: System processes the rejection, request status updates to 'Rejected', timestamp is recorded, and a confirmation message is displayed stating 'Request has been rejected successfully'

steps.action: Navigate back to the pending approvals list
steps.expectedResult: The rejected request no longer appears in the pending approvals list

steps.action: Verify the rejection is recorded by checking the request history or audit trail
steps.expectedResult: Request shows status as 'Rejected' with the approver's comments, timestamp, and approver identification visible

postconditions: Request status is updated to 'Rejected' in ScheduleChangeRequests table
Rejection decision with comments is recorded in ApprovalActions table
Timestamp and approver information are logged
Rejected request is removed from pending queue
Requester is able to view rejection status and comments

testCases.title: Validate audit logging of approval decisions
preconditions: Approver is logged into the system with valid credentials
At least one schedule change request is available for approval/rejection
Audit logging functionality is enabled in the system
User has permissions to view audit logs (if testing log retrieval)
ApprovalActions table is accessible and configured for logging

steps.action: Navigate to pending approvals and select a schedule change request
steps.expectedResult: Request details are displayed with approval and rejection options available

steps.action: Click 'Approve' button, enter comments 'Test approval for audit logging', and click 'Submit'
steps.expectedResult: Approval is processed successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Access the database or audit log interface to query ApprovalActions table for the submitted request ID
steps.expectedResult: Audit log entry is created containing: request ID, approver user ID, decision type (Approved), timestamp of decision, and comments entered

steps.action: Verify the timestamp recorded in the audit log matches the time of submission (within acceptable system time variance)
steps.expectedResult: Timestamp is accurate and reflects the actual time the approval decision was submitted

steps.action: Verify the approver information logged includes correct user ID and username
steps.expectedResult: Audit log shows correct approver identification matching the logged-in user who made the decision

steps.action: Select another pending request, reject it with comments 'Test rejection for audit logging', and submit
steps.expectedResult: Rejection is processed and confirmation is displayed

steps.action: Retrieve audit logs for the rejected request from ApprovalActions table
steps.expectedResult: New audit log entry exists showing: request ID, approver user ID, decision type (Rejected), accurate timestamp, and rejection comments

steps.action: Verify audit trail shows complete and accurate history of all approval actions for both requests
steps.expectedResult: Audit logs display chronological history of all decisions with complete information including user, timestamp, decision type, and comments for each action

postconditions: All approval and rejection decisions are logged in ApprovalActions table
Audit logs contain complete information: timestamp, user ID, decision type, and comments
Audit trail is retrievable and displays accurate historical data
No data integrity issues exist in audit logs
Logs are immutable and cannot be altered post-creation

storyTitle: As System Administrator, I want to configure approval workflow rules to achieve flexible and compliant schedule change processes

testCases.title: Validate creation and editing of approval workflow rules
preconditions: System Administrator account exists with valid credentials
Administrator has full permissions to access workflow configuration
System is operational and workflow configuration module is accessible
WorkflowRules table exists and is accessible in the database
At least one existing workflow rule is present in the system for editing

steps.action: Navigate to the system login page and enter valid administrator credentials
steps.expectedResult: Administrator is successfully authenticated and redirected to the admin dashboard

steps.action: Click on 'Workflow Configuration' or 'Approval Workflow Settings' menu item
steps.expectedResult: Workflow rule configuration page loads successfully displaying a list of all existing approval workflow rules with columns showing rule name, conditions, approver levels, and status

steps.action: Click on 'Create New Rule' or 'Add Rule' button
steps.expectedResult: New rule creation form opens with fields for rule name, description, routing conditions, approver roles/levels, and priority

steps.action: Enter rule details: Rule Name 'High Priority Schedule Changes', Condition 'Request Type = Urgent', Approver Level '2-Level Approval', Approver Roles 'Manager, Director'
steps.expectedResult: All fields accept input correctly and display entered information

steps.action: Click 'Save' button to save the new workflow rule
steps.expectedResult: System validates the rule configuration, saves it to WorkflowRules table, and displays confirmation message 'Workflow rule created successfully'

steps.action: Verify the newly created rule appears in the workflow rules list
steps.expectedResult: New rule 'High Priority Schedule Changes' is visible in the rules list with all configured details displayed correctly

steps.action: Select an existing workflow rule from the list by clicking the 'Edit' button or clicking on the rule name
steps.expectedResult: Rule editing form opens pre-populated with the current rule configuration including all conditions, approver levels, and settings

steps.action: Modify the rule by changing the Approver Level from '2-Level Approval' to '3-Level Approval' and adding 'VP' to Approver Roles
steps.expectedResult: Changes are accepted and displayed in the form fields

steps.action: Click 'Save Changes' button to update the workflow rule
steps.expectedResult: System validates the updated configuration, saves changes to WorkflowRules table, and displays confirmation message 'Workflow rule updated successfully'

steps.action: Verify the edited rule reflects the changes in the workflow rules list
steps.expectedResult: Updated rule shows modified approver level as '3-Level Approval' and includes 'VP' in the approver roles

steps.action: Create a test schedule change request that matches the new rule conditions
steps.expectedResult: New schedule change request is created and the system applies the newly configured workflow rule, routing it according to the defined approval levels

postconditions: New workflow rule is saved in WorkflowRules table with all configurations
Existing rule modifications are persisted in the database
Updated rules are immediately applied to new schedule change requests
Rule changes are logged in AuditLogs table with timestamp and administrator info
No existing pending requests are affected by the rule changes

testCases.title: Validate rule conflict detection
preconditions: Administrator is logged into the system with valid credentials
Administrator has access to workflow configuration page
At least one existing workflow rule is configured in the system
Rule validation engine is operational
System has conflict detection logic implemented

steps.action: Navigate to the workflow rule configuration page
steps.expectedResult: Configuration page loads displaying existing workflow rules

steps.action: Click 'Create New Rule' button to start creating a new workflow rule
steps.expectedResult: New rule creation form is displayed with all required fields

steps.action: Enter rule details that create a conflict with an existing rule: Same conditions but different approver routing (e.g., Rule Name 'Conflicting Rule', Condition 'Request Type = Urgent', Approver Level '1-Level' when existing rule has '2-Level' for same condition)
steps.expectedResult: Form accepts the input and displays the entered information

steps.action: Click 'Save' button to attempt saving the conflicting rule
steps.expectedResult: System validation detects the conflict and displays error message 'Conflict detected: A rule with the same conditions already exists. Please modify the conditions or update the existing rule.' Save operation is prevented

steps.action: Verify the conflicting rule is not saved to the database
steps.expectedResult: Conflicting rule does not appear in the workflow rules list and WorkflowRules table remains unchanged

steps.action: Attempt to create a circular dependency rule: Rule A routes to Approver Group 1, which routes back to Rule A's trigger condition
steps.expectedResult: Form accepts the input initially

steps.action: Click 'Save' button to attempt saving the circular rule
steps.expectedResult: System validation detects circular dependency and displays error message 'Circular dependency detected: This rule configuration creates an infinite loop. Please revise the routing logic.' Save operation is blocked

steps.action: Verify no circular rule is created in the system
steps.expectedResult: Rule is not saved and does not appear in the workflow rules list

steps.action: Create a valid rule without conflicts or circular dependencies with unique conditions
steps.expectedResult: Rule is validated successfully, saved to the database, and confirmation message 'Workflow rule created successfully' is displayed

postconditions: No conflicting rules exist in WorkflowRules table
No circular dependencies are present in the workflow configuration
System maintains data integrity with only valid rules saved
Error messages are logged for troubleshooting purposes
Valid rules are successfully saved and operational

testCases.title: Validate access control for workflow configuration
preconditions: System has role-based access control implemented
Non-administrator user account exists (e.g., Approver or Requester role)
Administrator account exists with workflow configuration permissions
Workflow configuration page URL is known
Authorization middleware is active and functioning

steps.action: Log into the system using non-administrator credentials (e.g., Approver role user)
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to their role-appropriate dashboard

steps.action: Verify that 'Workflow Configuration' menu item is not visible in the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Workflow Configuration option is hidden or not displayed in the user's menu, showing only options appropriate for their role

steps.action: Attempt to directly access the workflow configuration page by entering the URL in the browser (e.g., /admin/workflow-rules or /workflow-configuration)
steps.expectedResult: System denies access and displays error message 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to access this page' or 'Error 403: Forbidden' and redirects to unauthorized access page or user's home page

steps.action: Verify the user remains on an error page or is redirected away from workflow configuration
steps.expectedResult: User cannot access workflow configuration page and no workflow rules are visible

steps.action: Attempt to access workflow configuration API endpoint directly using API testing tool or browser console (e.g., GET /workflow-rules)
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden status code with error message 'Unauthorized: Administrator privileges required'

steps.action: Log out the non-administrator user and log in with valid administrator credentials
steps.expectedResult: Administrator is successfully authenticated and redirected to admin dashboard

steps.action: Verify 'Workflow Configuration' menu item is visible and accessible in the administrator's navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Workflow Configuration option is displayed in the menu

steps.action: Click on 'Workflow Configuration' menu item
steps.expectedResult: Workflow configuration page loads successfully displaying all existing workflow rules with full access to create, edit, and delete functionality

steps.action: Verify administrator can perform all workflow configuration operations
steps.expectedResult: Administrator has full access to view, create, edit, and manage workflow rules without any access restrictions

postconditions: Non-administrator users cannot access workflow configuration functionality
Access control is enforced at both UI and API levels
Unauthorized access attempts are logged in security audit logs
Administrator access remains functional and unrestricted
System security integrity is maintained

storyTitle: As Approver, I want to escalate pending schedule change requests to higher authority to ensure timely decision making

testCases.title: Validate manual escalation by approver
preconditions: User is logged in with Approver role and valid permissions
At least one pending schedule change request exists in the system
Higher-level approver is configured and available in the system
Escalation rules are properly configured
Notification service is operational

steps.action: Navigate to the pending schedule change requests dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard displays list of all pending schedule change requests with their details

steps.action: Select a specific pending schedule change request from the list
steps.expectedResult: Request details are displayed with available actions including escalation option

steps.action: Click on the 'Escalate' button or option for the selected request
steps.expectedResult: Escalation dialog or form appears prompting for escalation reason and higher-level approver selection

steps.action: Enter escalation reason and confirm the escalation action
steps.expectedResult: System processes the escalation request and displays confirmation message indicating successful escalation

steps.action: Verify the request status has been updated to 'Escalated'
steps.expectedResult: Request status shows as 'Escalated' and is routed to the designated higher-level approver

steps.action: Log in as the escalated higher-level approver and check notifications
steps.expectedResult: Escalated approver receives notification containing complete request details, escalation reason, and original approver information

steps.action: Verify the escalated request appears in the higher-level approver's pending queue
steps.expectedResult: Request is visible in the higher-level approver's dashboard with escalation indicator

postconditions: Schedule change request is successfully escalated to higher-level approver
Escalation action is logged in the system with timestamp and user details
Notification is sent to escalated approver
Request status reflects escalation state
Original approver can view escalation status

testCases.title: Validate automatic escalation of overdue requests
preconditions: System has automatic escalation feature enabled
SLA thresholds are configured in the system (e.g., 24 hours)
At least one pending schedule change request exists that can exceed SLA
Higher-level approvers are configured for automatic escalation
Escalation rules and routing logic are properly set up
System scheduler/cron job for checking SLA is running

steps.action: Create or identify a pending schedule change request in the system
steps.expectedResult: Pending request is created with timestamp and assigned to an approver

steps.action: Simulate or wait for the request to exceed the configured SLA threshold (e.g., modify system time or wait for actual threshold)
steps.expectedResult: Request remains pending beyond the configured SLA time limit

steps.action: Trigger the automatic escalation process (either wait for scheduled job or manually trigger if test environment allows)
steps.expectedResult: System detects the overdue request and initiates automatic escalation process

steps.action: Verify the request has been automatically escalated to the designated higher-level approver
steps.expectedResult: Request status changes to 'Escalated' and is routed to higher-level approver without manual intervention

steps.action: Check the escalation logs in the system audit trail
steps.expectedResult: Escalation action is logged with timestamp, reason (SLA exceeded), original approver, escalated approver, and system-generated escalation indicator

steps.action: Verify notifications were sent to the escalated approver
steps.expectedResult: Higher-level approver receives notification containing request details, SLA breach information, and escalation timestamp

steps.action: Log in as the escalated approver and verify the request appears in their queue
steps.expectedResult: Escalated request is visible in higher-level approver's dashboard with automatic escalation indicator and SLA breach details

steps.action: Verify the original approver is notified about the automatic escalation
steps.expectedResult: Original approver receives notification that the request has been escalated due to SLA breach

postconditions: Overdue request is automatically escalated to higher-level approver
Complete escalation history is logged with all relevant details
Notifications are sent to both escalated approver and original approver
Request status reflects automatic escalation
SLA breach is documented in the system
Escalation processing completed within 1 minute of SLA threshold breach

storyTitle: As Approver, I want to add comments to schedule change requests during approval to provide context for decisions

testCases.title: Validate adding and saving comments during approval
preconditions: User is logged in with Approver role and valid permissions
At least one pending schedule change request exists and is assigned to the logged-in approver
Database connection is active and ApprovalActions table is accessible
Comment input field is configured with maximum length of 500 characters

steps.action: Navigate to the pending schedule change requests dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard displays list of pending schedule change requests assigned to the approver

steps.action: Select and open a specific schedule change request for review
steps.expectedResult: Request details page opens displaying all request information including employee details, schedule changes, and approval options

steps.action: Verify the comment input field is visible on the approval form
steps.expectedResult: Comment input field is clearly visible and accessible with appropriate label (e.g., 'Add Comment' or 'Decision Rationale')

steps.action: Enter a valid comment in the comment field (e.g., 'Approved due to valid business justification and adequate coverage')
steps.expectedResult: Comment text is entered successfully in the input field without errors

steps.action: Click the 'Approve' button to submit the approval decision with the comment
steps.expectedResult: System processes the approval, displays success confirmation message, and indicates that approval with comment has been saved

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule change request history or details page
steps.expectedResult: Request history page displays the complete timeline of actions taken on the request

steps.action: Locate the approval action entry in the request history
steps.expectedResult: Approval action is displayed with timestamp, approver name, decision (Approved), and the comment text entered in step 4

steps.action: Verify the comment is properly linked to the approval action in the database
steps.expectedResult: Comment is stored in ApprovalActions table with correct foreign key relationship to the approval record

postconditions: Schedule change request is approved successfully
Comment is saved and linked to the approval action
Comment is visible in request history with proper attribution
Approval action with comment is logged with timestamp
Request status is updated to 'Approved'
Requester is notified of approval decision with comment

testCases.title: Validate comment length validation
preconditions: User is logged in with Approver role and valid permissions
At least one pending schedule change request exists and is assigned to the logged-in approver
Comment field validation is configured with maximum length of 500 characters
Input validation rules are active in the system

steps.action: Navigate to the pending schedule change requests dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard displays list of pending schedule change requests

steps.action: Select and open a schedule change request for approval
steps.expectedResult: Request details page opens with comment input field visible

steps.action: Generate and enter a comment text that exceeds 500 characters (e.g., 501 characters or more)
steps.expectedResult: Comment text is entered in the input field

steps.action: Attempt to submit the approval or rejection decision with the oversized comment
steps.expectedResult: System displays validation error message indicating that comment exceeds maximum allowed length of 500 characters

steps.action: Verify that the approval/rejection submission is blocked
steps.expectedResult: Form submission is prevented and user remains on the approval page with error message visible

steps.action: Verify the error message clearly indicates the character limit and current character count
steps.expectedResult: Error message displays specific information such as 'Comment must not exceed 500 characters' with character counter if available

steps.action: Reduce the comment text to exactly 500 characters or less
steps.expectedResult: Validation error clears and comment field shows valid state

steps.action: Submit the approval decision with the valid-length comment
steps.expectedResult: Approval is processed successfully and confirmation message is displayed

postconditions: Comment length validation is enforced correctly
Oversized comments are rejected with clear error message
Valid-length comments are accepted and saved
No approval action is saved when validation fails
User is able to correct and resubmit with valid comment

storyTitle: As Approver, I want to filter and sort schedule change requests in my queue to prioritize my workload effectively

testCases.title: Validate filtering by status and date range
preconditions: User is logged in with Approver role
Approver has access to pending requests dashboard
Multiple schedule change requests exist with varying statuses (Pending, Approved, Rejected)
Requests exist across different date ranges
At least 5 requests are assigned to the logged-in approver

steps.action: Navigate to the pending requests dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads successfully displaying all assigned schedule change requests

steps.action: Locate and click on the status filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Status filter dropdown opens showing available status options (Pending, Approved, Rejected, All)

steps.action: Select 'Pending' status from the dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Status filter is set to 'Pending' and dropdown closes

steps.action: Locate the date range filter and click on the 'From Date' field
steps.expectedResult: Date picker calendar opens for 'From Date' selection

steps.action: Select a specific start date (e.g., first day of current month)
steps.expectedResult: Selected date is populated in the 'From Date' field

steps.action: Click on the 'To Date' field
steps.expectedResult: Date picker calendar opens for 'To Date' selection

steps.action: Select a specific end date (e.g., last day of current month)
steps.expectedResult: Selected date is populated in the 'To Date' field

steps.action: Click 'Apply Filter' button
steps.expectedResult: Request list updates within 2 seconds to show only requests with 'Pending' status submitted within the selected date range. Request count is updated to reflect filtered results

steps.action: Verify each displayed request has 'Pending' status
steps.expectedResult: All displayed requests show 'Pending' status in the status column

steps.action: Verify each displayed request falls within the selected date range
steps.expectedResult: All displayed requests have submission dates between the selected 'From Date' and 'To Date'

postconditions: Request list displays only filtered results matching the applied criteria
Filter settings remain active until cleared or modified
Total request count reflects filtered results
Page performance remains within 2 seconds response time

testCases.title: Validate sorting by priority and submission date
preconditions: User is logged in with Approver role
Approver has access to pending requests dashboard
At least 10 schedule change requests are assigned to the approver
Requests have varying priority levels (High, Medium, Low)
Requests have different submission dates spanning multiple days
No filters are currently applied

steps.action: Navigate to the pending requests dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads successfully displaying all assigned schedule change requests in default order

steps.action: Locate the 'Priority' column header and click on it to sort
steps.expectedResult: Sort icon appears next to 'Priority' column header indicating descending order

steps.action: Observe the order of requests in the list
steps.expectedResult: Requests are ordered with highest priority first (High priority at top, followed by Medium, then Low priority). Request list updates within 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify the first 3 requests displayed have 'High' priority
steps.expectedResult: First 3 requests in the list show 'High' in the priority column

steps.action: Scroll down and verify requests with 'Low' priority appear at the bottom
steps.expectedResult: Requests with 'Low' priority are displayed at the bottom of the list

steps.action: Locate the 'Submission Date' column header and click on it
steps.expectedResult: Sort icon appears next to 'Submission Date' column header indicating ascending order. Previous priority sort is cleared

steps.action: Observe the order of requests in the list
steps.expectedResult: Requests are ordered from oldest to newest submission date. Request list updates within 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify the first request has the oldest submission date
steps.expectedResult: First request in the list displays the earliest submission date among all requests

steps.action: Scroll to the bottom and verify the last request has the most recent submission date
steps.expectedResult: Last request in the list displays the most recent submission date

steps.action: Click on 'Submission Date' column header again
steps.expectedResult: Sort order reverses to descending (newest to oldest). Sort icon updates to indicate descending order

postconditions: Request list is sorted according to the last applied sort criteria
Sort indicator is visible on the active column header
All requests remain visible with no data loss
Sort operation completes within 2 seconds

testCases.title: Validate saving and applying filter presets
preconditions: User is logged in with Approver role
Approver has access to pending requests dashboard
Multiple schedule change requests exist with varying statuses and dates
At least 15 requests are assigned to the approver
No saved filter presets exist for the current user

steps.action: Navigate to the pending requests dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads successfully displaying all assigned schedule change requests

steps.action: Apply filter for 'Pending' status
steps.expectedResult: Request list updates to show only pending requests

steps.action: Apply date range filter for current month
steps.expectedResult: Request list further filters to show only pending requests from current month

steps.action: Sort the filtered results by priority descending
steps.expectedResult: Filtered requests are sorted with highest priority first

steps.action: Locate and click on 'Save Filter Preset' button or icon
steps.expectedResult: Save preset dialog or modal opens prompting for preset name

steps.action: Enter preset name 'Current Month High Priority' in the name field
steps.expectedResult: Preset name is entered in the input field

steps.action: Click 'Save' button in the preset dialog
steps.expectedResult: Preset is saved successfully. Success message displays 'Filter preset saved successfully'. Dialog closes and returns to dashboard

steps.action: Clear all current filters by clicking 'Clear Filters' or 'Reset' button
steps.expectedResult: All filters and sorting are removed. Request list displays all assigned requests in default order

steps.action: Verify the request list shows all requests without any filters
steps.expectedResult: Request list displays all assigned requests including different statuses and dates

steps.action: Locate and click on 'Saved Presets' dropdown or button
steps.expectedResult: Dropdown menu opens displaying saved presets including 'Current Month High Priority'

steps.action: Select 'Current Month High Priority' preset from the list
steps.expectedResult: Preset is applied. Request list updates within 2 seconds to show pending requests from current month sorted by priority descending

steps.action: Verify filter indicators show 'Pending' status and current month date range
steps.expectedResult: Status filter displays 'Pending' and date range filter shows current month dates

steps.action: Verify sort indicator shows priority descending
steps.expectedResult: Priority column header shows descending sort indicator

steps.action: Verify the request list matches the previously saved filter criteria
steps.expectedResult: Request list displays the same filtered and sorted results as when the preset was saved

postconditions: Filter preset 'Current Month High Priority' is saved in the system
Preset is available for future use
Request list displays results according to the applied preset
Filter and sort settings match the saved preset configuration
Preset can be reapplied at any time
